{"step_by_step_thinking": "Exosomes are small vesicles that are released by cells and can carry various molecules, including proteins, lipids, and nucleic acids. APP, or Amyloid Precursor Protein, is a type of protein that can be found in various parts of the body, including the brain. Given that exosomes can carry proteins and APP is a protein, it is plausible that brain derived exosomes can carry APP molecules.", "answer_choice": "A"}
